title: Test MCP Integration with chora-compose
deliverables: Test chora-compose MCP server connection and verify all 24 tools are accessible
Generate sample coordination request using chora-compose to validate output quality
Measure generation time and token usage for inbox creation workflow
Document API endpoints and data formats required for MCP integration
Compare generated output quality against Week 4 pilot baseline (94.9%)
Create decision matrix comparing Path A/B vs Path C with effort estimates
Identify technical blockers or limitations in chora-compose capabilities
Produce implementation recommendation with selected path and justification
acceptance_criteria: MCP server connection establishes successfully within 30 seconds
≥5 chora-compose tools are tested with documented responses
Path A/B feasibility assessment covers ≥3 integration requirements
Path C standalone approach is evaluated with ≥2 complexity factors
Implementation time estimates differ by ≤20% from 8-16h vs 20-30h ranges
Decision matrix compares ≥4 criteria (time, quality, maintainability, risk)
Test results document ≥3 specific MCP capabilities for inbox generation
Recommendation includes concrete next steps with ≤2 hour time blocks
Quality threshold maintains ≥94% consistency with Week 4 pilot results

context.background: Week 4 pilot complete (94.9% quality). Discovered production MCP server with 24 tools running in Docker on port 8000.
context.rationale: Need to test MCP capabilities before deciding between Path A/B (8-16 hours with chora-compose) vs Path C (20-30 hours standalone)
